channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Coronavirus: Grab slashes senior managers' pay by up to 20%, tells drivers that extra financial help may stop after June 1
item.description:
April 30, 2020 8:06 AM

SINGAPORE - Grab has slashed the pay of its senior management by up to 20 per cent and encouraged its staff members to take voluntary no-pay leave.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on April 30
Stay-home reads: All about food - 8 cup noodles that are worth eating (and the best time to dig in)
item.description:
April 30, 2020 8:00 AM

Which cup noodles are worth the calories? Is it safe to eat the leftovers another day? Let's talk about food - the good, the bad and the deliciously sinful.

item.title: Major effort under way to determine extent of Covid-19 infection among Singapore's population
item.description:
April 30, 2020 5:00 AM

A key focus is to find out how many have been infected but did not show any symptoms, and were therefore not tested for the virus.

item.title: Recalling a stressed jobless man and a crying elderly woman
item.description:
April 30, 2020 5:00 AM

The elderly woman who called in seeking support was crying, saying repeatedly that she needed a specific spice from the supermarket.

item.title: 3 charged with flouting Covid-19 control order, 2 accused of harassment
item.description:
April 30, 2020 5:00 AM

Beauty salons and such have been ordered shut under measures introduced to stem the coronavirus spread, but that did not stop one woman from allegedly offering massage and sexual services.

item.title: Singapore in a good position to do mass Covid-19 testing, say experts
item.description:
April 30, 2020 5:00 AM

Increased testing could be a key enabler for the country as it looks to gradually lift the circuit breaker measures, they say.

item.title: NTUC, Govt and employers pledge to safeguard lives and livelihoods
item.description:
April 30, 2020 5:00 AM

The labour movement, Government and employers yesterday pledged their solidarity with workers in tackling the Covid-19 pandemic, and their steadfast commitment to protecting lives and livelihoods.

item.title: 260 masks given to homeless as part of community mask sewing project
item.description:
April 30, 2020 5:00 AM

About 260 reusable face masks were given yesterday to homeless people supported by the Singapore Anglican Community Services.

item.title: Low community transmission rate until mid-March: Study
item.description:
April 30, 2020 5:00 AM

Local transmission of the coronavirus in the community has been low, at least up until the middle of last month, researchers from the Covid-19 research group at the National Centre for Infectious Diseases (NCID) have found.

item.title: Singapore visitor arrivals in March lowest since Sars
item.description:
April 30, 2020 5:00 AM

The number of visitors to Singapore plummeted to about 240,000 last month, the lowest since the severe acute respiratory syndrome (Sars) outbreak hit the Republic in 2003.

item.title: Man who breached virus rules harassed, threatened officers
item.description:
April 30, 2020 5:00 AM

A recalcitrant offender hurled vulgarities at a police officer on April 14 after he unlawfully met a friend for a chat in Whampoa amid the coronavirus outbreak.

item.title: Coronavirus: Dental group, biotech firm to provide 20,000 free tests
item.description:
April 30, 2020 5:00 AM

It started with one company's altruistic intentions and grew into a partnership for a greater good.

item.title: Motion filed to discuss home-based F&B curbs
item.description:
April 30, 2020 5:00 AM

An adjournment motion has been filed for Parliament to take up the matter of home-based food business operations amid the Covid-19 outbreak at its next sitting on May 4.

item.title: $6.3m lost to scammers posing as China officials
item.description:
April 30, 2020 5:00 AM

Scammers posing as officials from China have hoodwinked 139 people into giving away at least $6.3 million in the first three months of this year.

item.title: Coronavirus: Protection for healthcare staff in Singapore adequate so far
item.description:
April 30, 2020 5:00 AM

Measures to protect Singapore's healthcare workers from getting Covid-19 have so far been effective, going by the early results of an ongoing study at three public hospitals.

item.title: ComfortDelGro starts its own food delivery service
item.description:
April 30, 2020 5:00 AM

Taxi giant ComfortDelGro is muscling into the booming food delivery business with ComfortDelivery, which capitalises on the company's fleet of around 10,000 cabs to make deliveries for food and beverage (F&B) outlets.

item.title: Pupils hone their writing skills in ST Masterclass
item.description:
April 30, 2020 5:00 AM

Strong characters and a well-developed plot are two important ingredients for a good piece of creative writing, said educator Nicolette Ng. It is also important to read widely and regularly.

item.title: Big names join hands in battle against coronavirus
item.description:
April 30, 2020 5:00 AM

Big names in the medical and science community have joined forces since January to study the coronavirus outbreak and how to stop it from spreading further.

item.title: Fewer corruption reports in 2019 but more cases probed
item.description:
April 30, 2020 5:00 AM

The Corrupt Practices Investigation Bureau received 350 corruption-related reports last year, a six-year low.

item.title: Hint of measures having an impact as coronavirus cases in Singapore top 15,000
item.description:
April 30, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore reported a further 690 new Covid-19 cases yesterday, pushing the total past 15,000, as the country approaches its first full month under the circuit breaker measures.

item.title: Staying safe from cyberscams as we stay home
item.description:
April 30, 2020 5:00 AM

On April 21, Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong announced tighter circuit breaker measures - more closures of businesses and more restrictions on movement.

item.title: Only 5% who shared a home with patients caught Covid-19
item.description:
April 30, 2020 5:00 AM

Only 5 per cent of people who shared a home with coronavirus patients eventually contracted the disease, a new study by the National Centre for Infectious Diseases (NCID) has found.

item.title: Waste dumping case shows graft's serious consequences
item.description:
April 30, 2020 5:00 AM

As a supervisor at a Sengkang West worksite, he had the authority to allow entry to authorised vehicles for regulated unloading of waste.

item.title: 10 must-reads for today
item.description:
April 30, 2020 5:00 AM

After a four-month suspension due to a training incident, the Singapore Armed Forces resumed parachute jump training involving cords on Tuesday, but with new safety measures. The measures were reviewed by the Army Safety Board and validated through trial jumps conducted by regular commando soldiers, including the Chief Commando Officer.

item.title: How does new rule on dog walking, exercising help with safe distancing?
item.description:
April 30, 2020 5:00 AM

Since the circuit breaker started on April 7, we have been told to stay home to stay safe and to exercise within our neighbourhood. All common facilities within condominium developments have been shut since then and we have restricted our jogging and brisk walking activities to within our development.

item.title: Coronavirus: Sharpest quarterly fall in employment since Sars in 2003
item.description:
April 30, 2020 5:00 AM

The number of people working in Singapore, excluding maids, plunged by 19,900 in the first three months of the year as the early impact of the Covid-19 pandemic disrupted economic activity.

item.title: ERP, COE bidding to remain suspended next month
item.description:
April 30, 2020 5:00 AM

Electronic road pricing (ERP) and certificate of entitlement (COE) bidding will continue to be suspended next month, and will resume only when the extended circuit breaker period ends on June 1.

item.title: Shanmugam: Fake news used to stir up unhappiness in dorms
item.description:
April 30, 2020 5:00 AM

Some people have been spreading fake news about the situation in foreign worker dormitories here, to incite fear, panic and hopefully, violence, said Law and Home Affairs Minister K. Shanmugam yesterday.

item.title: Of touchlines and frontlines
item.description:
April 30, 2020 5:00 AM

In recent weeks, Adrian Pennock has often found himself trekking through the jungles of Brunei.

item.title: Coronavirus: Range of cost-cutting measures by firms to affect 100,000
item.description:
April 30, 2020 5:00 AM

An initial picture of the impact of measures that firms are taking as a result of the coronavirus pandemic has emerged.

item.title: New safety measures as SAF parachute training resumes after 4 months
item.description:
April 30, 2020 5:00 AM

After a four-month suspension due to a training incident, the Singapore Armed Forces (SAF) resumed parachute jump training involving cords on Tuesday, but with new safety measures.

item.title: Coronavirus: Five more clusters emerge as Singapore reports 690 new cases
item.description:
April 30, 2020 5:00 AM

Five new clusters have been identified, as foreign workers continued to form the majority of the 690 new Covid-19 cases reported here.

item.title: From polymerase chain reaction to antibody tests: A look at Covid-19 tests and their uses
item.description:
April 30, 2020 5:00 AM

If polymerase chain reaction (PCR) tests are the foot soldiers in the war against Covid-19, then antibody tests (or serology tests) are the generals. The PCR test allows for immediate action in case a person is currently infected, while the serology test shows if current measures are working well and shapes future policy planning. Here is a look at the different types of tests and how they are done.

item.title: Growth in local employment in healthcare, professional services
item.description:
April 30, 2020 5:00 AM

Local employment still grew in the first quarter of the year in the healthcare and professional services industries as well as in public administration despite the brewing coronavirus crisis, preliminary data released by the Ministry of Manpower (MOM) yesterday showed.

item.title: Duo give out free meals to the elderly
Dorm meals are getting better: Zaqy
item.description:
April 30, 2020 5:00 AM

Rice, fried chicken, cauliflower, curry and idli (steamed rice cake) - that was yesterday's pre-dawn meal for Muslim foreign workers at Sungei Tengah Lodge.

item.title: Over 6,600 calls made to National Care Hotline
item.description:
April 30, 2020 5:00 AM

More than 6,600 calls have been made to the National Care Hotline since its launch on April 10, said Minister for Social and Family Development Desmond Lee in a Facebook post yesterday.

item.title: Man fined for leaving flat 30 minutes before quarantine ended
item.description:
April 30, 2020 5:00 AM

From a bak kut teh meal to that must-have breakfast fare, timing is everything when it comes to food cravings and measures introduced to stem the spread of the coronavirus.

item.title: Caring for people with special needs
item.description:
April 30, 2020 4:00 AM

Pursuing a Bachelor of Arts (Majoring in Psychology) at James Cook University laid the foundation for Miss Goh Hui Ting to pave a career as a psychologist.

item.title: Maritime industry to get $27 million aid package with more support for Singaporean seafarers
item.description:
April 30, 2020 12:09 AM

SINGAPORE - The Singapore maritime industry will get a further $27 million in aid to tide it over the coronavirus outbreak, the Maritime and Port Authority of Singapore (MPA) announced late Wednesday night (April 29).
